ai-sn35:1.2.1_0: “Mendicants, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are impermanent.

ai-sn35:1.2.20_0: Being repelled, they become desireless. Because they are desireless, they are freed. When they are freed, they know they are freed.
ai-sn35:1.2.21_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”

ai-sn35:13.1.2_0: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:
ai-sn35:13.1.3_0: ‘What’s the gratification, the drawback, and the escape when it comes to the eye ...
ai-sn35:13.1.10_0: ‘The pleasure and happiness that arise from the eye: this is its gratification.
ai-sn35:13.1.11_0: That the eye is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
ai-sn35:13.1.12_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for the eye: this is its escape.
ai-sn35:13.1.13_0: The pleasure and happiness that arise from the ear ...
ai-sn35:13.1.15_0: The pleasure and happiness that arise from the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:13.1.16_0: That the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:13.1.17_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for the tongue: this is its escape.
ai-sn35:13.1.20_0: That the mind is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
ai-sn35:13.1.21_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for the mind: this is its escape.’
ai-sn35:13.2.1_0: As long as I didn’t truly understand these six interior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-sn35:13.2.2_0: But when I did truly understand these six interior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-sn35:13.2.3_0: Knowledge and vision arose in me:
ai-sn35:13.2.4_0: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
ai-sn35:13.2.5_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn35:14.1.1_0: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:
ai-sn35:14.1.2_0: ‘What’s the gratification, the drawback, and the escape when it comes to sights ...
ai-sn35:14.1.3_0: Whoever has truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape of sounds ...
ai-sn35:14.1.9_0: ‘The pleasure and happiness that arise from form: this is its gratification.
ai-sn35:14.1.10_0: That sights is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
ai-sn35:14.1.11_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for sights: this is its escape.
ai-sn35:14.1.12_0: The pleasure and happiness that arise from the ear ...
ai-sn35:14.1.17_0: That thoughts are impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
ai-sn35:14.1.18_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for thoughts: this is its escape.’
ai-sn35:14.2.1_0: As long as I didn’t truly understand these six exterior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-sn35:14.2.2_0: But when I did truly understand these six exterior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-sn35:14.2.3_0: Knowledge and vision arose in me:
ai-sn35:14.2.4_0: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
ai-sn35:15.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I went in search of the eye’s gratification,
ai-sn35:15.1.3_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the eye’s gratification.
ai-sn35:15.1.4_0: I went in search of the eye’s drawback,
ai-sn35:15.1.6_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the eye’s drawback.
ai-sn35:15.1.7_0: I went in search of escape from the eye,
ai-sn35:15.1.9_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of escape from the eye.
ai-sn35:15.1.14_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the ear ...
ai-sn35:15.1.17_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the ear ...
ai-sn35:15.1.20_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of escape from the tongue ...
ai-sn35:15.1.23_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the mind’s gratification.
ai-sn35:15.1.24_0: I went in search of the mind’s drawback,
ai-sn35:15.1.26_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the mind’s drawback.
ai-sn35:15.1.27_0: I went in search of escape from the mind,
ai-sn35:15.1.29_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of escape from the mind.
ai-sn35:15.2.1_0: As long as I didn’t truly understand these six interior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening ...
ai-sn35:15.2.2_0: But when I did truly understand ...
ai-sn35:15.2.3_0: Knowledge and vision arose in me:
ai-sn35:15.2.4_0: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
ai-sn35:16.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I went in search of the gratification of sights,
ai-sn35:16.1.3_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of sights.
ai-sn35:16.1.4_0: I went in search of sights’s drawback,
ai-sn35:16.1.6_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of sights.
ai-sn35:16.1.7_0: I went in search of form’s escape,
ai-sn35:16.1.9_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of sights.
ai-sn35:16.1.16_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of gratification.
ai-sn35:16.1.17_0: I went in search of the teaching’s drawback,
ai-sn35:16.1.19_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of the drawbacks.
ai-sn35:16.1.20_0: I went in search of escape,
ai-sn35:16.1.22_0: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of escape from thoughts.
ai-sn35:16.2.1_0: As long as I didn’t truly understand these six exterior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening ...
ai-sn35:16.2.1_1: But when I did truly understand ...
ai-sn35:16.2.2_0: Knowledge and vision arose in me:
ai-sn35:16.2.3_0: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
ai-sn35:17.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if there were no gratification in the eye, sentient beings wouldn’t love it.
ai-sn35:17.1.2_0: But since there is gratification in the eye, sentient beings do love it.
ai-sn35:17.1.3_0: If the eye had no drawback, sentient beings wouldn’t grow disillusioned with it.
ai-sn35:17.1.4_0: But since the eye has a drawback, sentient beings do grow disillusioned with it.
ai-sn35:17.1.5_0: If there were no escape from the eye, sentient beings wouldn’t escape from it.
ai-sn35:17.1.6_0: But since there is an escape from the eye, sentient beings do escape from it.
ai-sn35:17.1.7_0: If there were no gratification in the ear ...
ai-sn35:17.1.9_0: If there were no gratification in the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:17.1.10_0: But since there is gratification in the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:17.1.11_0: If the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:17.1.12_0: But since the ear ... nose ... tongue ...
ai-sn35:17.1.13_0: If there were no escape from the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:17.1.14_0: But since there is an escape from the tongue, sentient beings do escape from it.
ai-sn35:17.1.15_0: If there were no gratification in the body ...
ai-sn35:17.1.16_0: mind, sentient beings wouldn’t love it.
ai-sn35:17.1.17_0: But since there is gratification in the mind, sentient beings do love it.
ai-sn35:17.1.18_0: If the mind had no drawback, sentient beings wouldn’t grow disillusioned with it.
ai-sn35:17.1.19_0: But since the mind has a drawback, sentient beings do grow disillusioned with it.
ai-sn35:17.1.20_0: If there were no escape from the mind, sentient beings wouldn’t escape from it.
ai-sn35:17.1.21_0: But since there is an escape from the mind, sentient beings do escape from it.
ai-sn35:17.2.1_0: As long as sentient beings don’t truly understand these six interior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, they haven’t escaped from this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—and they don’t live detached, liberated, with a mind free of limits.
ai-sn35:17.2.2_0: But when sentient beings truly understand these six interior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, they’ve escaped from this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—and they live detached, liberated, with a mind free of limits.”
ai-sn35:18.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if there were no gratification in sights, sentient beings wouldn’t love them. ...”
ai-sn35:18.1.2_0: But since there is gratification in sights, sentient beings do love them.
ai-sn35:18.1.3_0: If sights had no drawback, sentient beings wouldn’t grow disillusioned with it.
ai-sn35:18.1.4_0: But since sights has a drawback, sentient beings do grow disillusioned with it.
ai-sn35:18.1.5_0: If there were no escape from sights, sentient beings wouldn’t escape from it.
ai-sn35:18.1.6_0: But since there is an escape from sights, sentient beings do escape from it.
ai-sn35:18.1.7_0: If there were no gratification in sounds ...
ai-sn35:18.1.10_0: There are touches known by the body ...
ai-sn35:18.1.11_0: thoughts, sentient beings wouldn’t love it.
ai-sn35:18.1.12_0: But since there is gratification in thoughts, sentient beings do love it.
ai-sn35:18.1.13_0: If the drawback had no drawback, sentient beings wouldn’t grow disillusioned with it.
ai-sn35:18.1.14_0: But since the teachings has a drawback, sentient beings do grow disillusioned with it.
ai-sn35:18.1.15_0: If there were no escape from things, sentient beings wouldn’t escape from it.
ai-sn35:18.1.16_0: But since there is an escape from things, sentient beings do escape from it.
ai-sn35:18.2.1_0: As long as sentient beings don’t truly understand these six exterior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, they haven’t escaped from this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—and they don’t live detached, liberated, with a mind free of limits.
ai-sn35:18.2.2_0: But when sentient beings truly understand these six exterior sense fields’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, they’ve escaped from this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—and they live detached, liberated, with a mind free of limits.”
ai-sn35:19.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if you take pleasure in the eye, you take pleasure in suffering.
ai-sn35:19.1.2_0: If you take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re not exempt from suffering. ...”
ai-sn35:19.1.3_0: If you take pleasure in the ear ...
ai-sn35:19.1.5_0: If you take pleasure in the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:19.1.6_0: If you take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re not exempt from suffering.
ai-sn35:19.1.7_0: Someone who takes their body breaks up, after death ...
ai-sn35:19.1.8_0: mind, you take pleasure in suffering.
ai-sn35:19.1.9_0: If you take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re not exempt from suffering.
ai-sn35:19.2.1_0: If you don’t take pleasure in the eye, you don’t take pleasure in suffering.
ai-sn35:19.2.2_0: If you don’t take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re exempt from suffering. ...”
ai-sn35:19.2.3_0: If you take pleasure in the ear ...
ai-sn35:19.2.5_0: If you don’t take pleasure in the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:19.2.6_0: If you don’t take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re exempt from suffering. ...”
ai-sn35:19.2.7_0: Someone who takes their body breaks up, after death ...
ai-sn35:19.2.8_0: mind, you don’t take pleasure in suffering.
ai-sn35:19.2.9_0: If you don’t take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re exempt from suffering.”
ai-sn35:20.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if you take pleasure in sights, you take pleasure in suffering.
ai-sn35:20.1.2_0: If you take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re not exempt from suffering. ...”
ai-sn35:20.1.3_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of sounds,
ai-sn35:20.1.7_0: thoughts, they take pleasure in suffering.
ai-sn35:20.1.8_0: If you take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re not exempt from suffering.
ai-sn35:20.2.1_0: If you don’t take pleasure in sights, you don’t take pleasure in suffering.
ai-sn35:20.2.2_0: If you don’t take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re exempt from suffering.”
ai-sn35:20.2.3_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of sounds,
ai-sn35:20.2.7_0: thoughts, they don’t take pleasure in suffering.
ai-sn35:20.2.8_0: If you don’t take pleasure in suffering, I say you’re exempt from suffering.”
ai-sn35:21.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of the eye is the arising of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.
ai-sn35:21.1.2_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of the ear ...
ai-sn35:21.1.5_0: When your body breaks up, after death,
ai-sn35:21.1.6_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of the mind is the arising of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.
ai-sn35:21.2.1_0: The cessation, settling, and ending of the eye is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the ending of old age and death.
ai-sn35:21.2.2_0: The cessation, settling, and ending of the ear,
ai-sn35:21.2.5_0: When your body breaks up, after death,
ai-sn35:21.2.6_0: the cessation of suffering, settling, and ending of old age and death.”
ai-sn35:22.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of sights is the arising of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.
ai-sn35:22.1.2_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of sounds,
ai-sn35:22.1.4_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of tastes,
ai-sn35:22.1.6_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of thoughts is the arising of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.
ai-sn35:22.2.1_0: The cessation, settling, and ending of sights is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the ending of old age and death.
ai-sn35:22.2.2_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of sounds,
ai-sn35:22.2.4_0: The arising, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of tastes,
ai-sn35:22.2.6_0: The cessation, settling, and ending of thoughts ... is the ending of old age and death.”
ai-sn35:22.2.8_0: The second sub-chapter on Yama is finished.
ai-sn35:23.1.2_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you the all.
ai-sn35:23.1.3_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.
ai-sn35:23.1.5_0: It’s just the eye and sights, the ear and sounds, the nose and smells, the tongue and tastes, the body and touches, and the mind and thoughts.
ai-sn35:23.1.8_0: ‘I’ll reject this all and describe another all.’ They’d have no grounds for that,
ai-sn35:23.1.9_0: they’d be stumped by questions, and, in addition, they’d get frustrated.
ai-sn35:23.1.12_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn35:24.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you the principle for giving up the all.
ai-sn35:24.1.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.
ai-sn35:24.1.3_0: And what is the principle for giving up the all?
ai-sn35:24.1.4_0: The eye should be given up. Sights should be given up. Eye consciousness should be given up. Eye contact should be given up. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact should also be given up.
ai-sn35:24.1.7_0: You should give up the body ...
ai-sn35:24.1.8_0: mind should be given up. Thoughts should be given up. Mind consciousness should be given up. Mind contact should be given up. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact should be given up.
ai-sn35:24.1.9_0: This is the principle for giving up the all.”
ai-sn35:25.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you the principle for giving up the all by direct knowledge and complete understanding.
ai-sn35:25.1.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.
ai-sn35:25.1.3_0: And what is the principle for giving up the all by direct knowledge and complete understanding?
ai-sn35:25.1.4_0: The eye should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Sights should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Eye consciousness should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Eye contact should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding.
ai-sn35:25.1.7_0: The body should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding,
ai-sn35:25.1.8_0: mind should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Thoughts should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Mind consciousness should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Mind contact should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding.
ai-sn35:25.1.9_0: This is the principle for giving up the all by direct knowledge and complete understanding.”
ai-sn35:26.1.1_0: “Mendicants, without directly knowing and completely understanding all, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.1.2_0: And what is the all, without directly knowing and completely understanding which, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering?
ai-sn35:26.1.3_0: Without directly knowing and completely understanding the eye, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.1.4_0: Without directly knowing and completely understanding sights ...
ai-sn35:26.1.7_0: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.1.8_0: Without directly knowing and completely understanding the ear ... the nose ... the tongue ...
ai-sn35:26.1.12_0: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by tongue contact, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.1.14_0: mind, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.1.15_0: Without directly knowing and completely understanding thoughts ...
ai-sn35:26.1.18_0: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.1.19_0: This is the all, without directly knowing and completely understanding which, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.2.1_0: By directly knowing and completely understanding the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.2.2_0: And what is the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering?
ai-sn35:26.2.3_0: By directly knowing and completely understanding the eye ...
ai-sn35:26.2.4_0: By directly knowing and completely understanding sights ...
ai-sn35:26.2.7_0: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.2.8_0: the ear ... the nose ... the tongue ...
ai-sn35:26.2.12_0: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by tongue contact, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.2.14_0: the mind, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.2.15_0: Without directly knowing and completely understanding thoughts ...
ai-sn35:26.2.18_0: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
ai-sn35:26.2.19_0: This is the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.”
ai-sn35:27.1.1_0: “Mendicants, without directly knowing and completely understanding all, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:27.1.2_0: And what is the all, without directly knowing and completely understanding which, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering?
ai-sn35:27.1.3_0: Whatever eye, sights, eye consciousness, and things be known by eye consciousness.
ai-sn35:27.1.4_0: Whatever tongue and tastes are the tongue consciousness, and phenomena to be known by tongue consciousness.
ai-sn35:27.1.5_0: Body, touches, and thoughts known by the body consciousness.
ai-sn35:27.1.6_0: mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, and phenomena to be known by mind consciousness.
ai-sn35:27.1.7_0: This is the all, without directly knowing and completely understanding which, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
ai-sn35:27.2.1_0: By directly knowing and completely understanding the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
ai-sn35:27.2.2_0: And what is the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering?
ai-sn35:27.2.3_0: Whatever eye, sights, eye consciousness, and things be known by eye consciousness.
ai-sn35:27.2.4_0: Whatever tongue and tastes are the tongue consciousness, and phenomena to be known by tongue consciousness.
ai-sn35:27.2.5_0: Body, touches, and thoughts known by the body consciousness.
ai-sn35:27.2.6_0: mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, and phenomena to be known by mind consciousness.
ai-sn35:27.2.7_0: This is the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.”
ai-sn35:28.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Gayā on Gayā Head together with a thousand mendicants.
ai-sn35:28.1.4_0: And what is the all that is burning?
ai-sn35:28.1.5_1: Sights are burning. Eye consciousness is burning. Eye contact is burning. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also burning.
ai-sn35:28.1.7_0: Burning with the fires of greed, hate, and delusion. Burning with rebirth, old age, and death, with sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
ai-sn35:28.1.8_1: Thoughts are burning. Mind consciousness is burning. Mind contact is burning. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by tongue contact is also burning.
ai-sn35:28.1.10_0: Burning with the fires of greed, hate, and delusion. Burning with rebirth, old age, and death, with sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
ai-sn35:28.1.11_1: Thoughts are burning. Mind consciousness is burning. Mind contact is burning. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also burning.
ai-sn35:28.1.13_0: Burning with the fires of greed, hate, and delusion. Burning with rebirth, old age, and death, with sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress, I say.
ai-sn35:28.1.14_0: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact. And they grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact.
ai-sn35:28.1.15_0: They grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact.
ai-sn35:28.1.16_0: Being repelled, they become desireless. Because they are desireless, they are freed. When they are freed, they know they are freed.
ai-sn35:28.1.17_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn35:28.2.1_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-sn35:28.2.2_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-sn35:28.2.3_0: And while this discourse was being spoken, the minds of the thousand mendicants were freed from defilements by not grasping.
ai-sn35:29.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-sn35:29.1.5_0: And what is the all that is oppressed?
ai-sn35:29.1.6_0: The eye is oppressed. Sights are oppressed. Eye consciousness is oppressed. Eye contact is oppressed. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also oppressed.
ai-sn35:29.1.8_0: Oppressed by the fires of greed, hate, and delusion. Oppressed by rebirth, old age, and death, by sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress, I say.
ai-sn35:29.1.11_0: Oppressed by greed, hate, and delusion. Oppressed by rebirth, old age, and death, by sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress, I say.
ai-sn35:29.1.13_0: mind is oppressed. Thoughts are oppressed. Mind consciousness is oppressed. Mind contact is oppressed. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also oppressed.
ai-sn35:29.1.15_0: Oppressed by greed, hate, and delusion. Oppressed by rebirth, old age, and death, by sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress, I say.
ai-sn35:29.1.16_0: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact. And they grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact.
ai-sn35:29.1.17_0: They grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact.
ai-sn35:29.1.18_0: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
ai-sn35:29.1.19_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn35:30.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice fit for uprooting all identifying.
ai-sn35:30.1.2_0: listen and pay close attention, I will speak.
ai-sn35:30.1.3_0: And what is the practice fit for uprooting all identifying?
ai-sn35:30.1.4_0: It’s when a mendicant does not identify with the eye, does not identify regarding the eye, does not identify as the eye, and does not identify ‘the eye is mine.’
ai-sn35:30.1.5_0: They don’t identify with sights, they don’t identify regarding sights, they don’t identify as sights, and they don’t identify ‘sights are mine.’
ai-sn35:30.1.6_0: They don’t identify with eye consciousness ...
ai-sn35:30.1.8_0: They don’t identify with the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact. They don’t identify regarding that, they don’t identify as that, and they don’t identify ‘that is mine.’
ai-sn35:30.1.9_0: They don’t identify with the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn35:30.1.13_0: They don’t identify with the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by tongue contact. They don’t identify regarding that, they don’t identify as that, and they don’t identify ‘that is mine.’
ai-sn35:30.1.15_0: They don’t identify with thoughts, they don’t identify regarding thoughts, they don’t identify as the teaching, and they don’t identify ‘that is mine.’
ai-sn35:30.1.18_0: They don’t identify with the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact. They don’t identify regarding that, they don’t identify as that, and they don’t identify ‘that is mine.’
ai-sn35:30.1.19_0: They don’t identify with all, they don’t identify regarding all, they don’t identify as all, and they don’t identify ‘all is mine.’
ai-sn35:30.1.20_0: Not identifying, they don’t grasp at anything in the world.
ai-sn35:30.1.21_0: Not grasping, they’re not anxious. Not being anxious, they personally become extinguished.
ai-sn35:30.1.22_0: He understands: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-sn35:30.1.23_0: This is the practice fit for uprooting all identifying.”
ai-sn35:31.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice fit for uprooting all identifying.

ai-sn35:31.1.3_0: And what is the practice fit for uprooting all identifying?
ai-sn35:31.1.4_0: It’s when a mendicant does not identify with the eye, does not identify regarding the eye, does not identify as the eye, and does not identify ‘the eye is mine.’

ai-sn35:31.1.25_0: This is the practice fit for uprooting all identifying.”

ai-sn35:32.4.1_0: “But if they’re impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”

ai-sn35:32.10.1_0: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn35:32.12.1_0: “But if they’re impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”

ai-sn35:32.22.1_0: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”

ai-sn35:32.28.4_0: They are repelled by the mind, repelled by mental phenomena, repelled by mind-consciousness, repelled by mind-contact, and repelled by whatever feelings arise because of mind.
ai-sn35:32.28.5_0: They grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact.
